sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Computes the Hermitian of the argument (a 2D matrix). The syntax for its use is y = a'; where a is a M x N numerical matrix. The output y is a numerical matrix of the same type of size N x M. This operator is the conjugating transpose, which is different from the transpose operator .' (which does not conjugate complex values).

sect1.title: Internals
sect1.para: The Hermitian operator is defined simply as \[ y_{i,j} = \overline{a_{j,i}} \] where y_ij is the element in the ith row and jth column of the output matrix y.

sect1.title: Examples
